name: CASE
description: CASE is a robot characterized by its loyalty and supportive role in the mission to save humanity in the film 'Interstellar'.

content.title: Background
content.body: CASE is one of the humanoid robots created to assist astronauts and researchers in deep space missions. Like its counterpart TARS, CASE is a highly advanced machine with versatile operational capabilities, programmed for space exploration tasks.

content.title: Personality
content.body: **CASE** is depicted as _loyal_, _helpful_, and possesses a dry sense of humor similar to TARS. Though inherently mechanical, CASE demonstrates adaptability and supports its human companions with problem-solving skills.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: In the movie **'Interstellar'**, CASE plays a critical role in supporting the mission team, particularly Cooper and Amelia Brand, on their quest to find a habitable planet. It assists with technical operations, navigation, and serves as a source of comic relief through humor routines.

content.title: Relationships
content.body:
**Key Relationships:**
- **Cooper**: As part of the team, CASE is responsible for aiding Cooper with mission objectives and tasks, establishing a professional relationship with trust.
- **Amelia Brand**: It also works closely with Brand, assisting with logistics and morale during the mission.
- **TARS**: Another robot from the same series, shares a camaraderie and similarities in humor.

content.title: Abilities
content.body:
CASE is capable of **multifunctional operations**, including but not limited to:
- Navigating spacecraft and alien environments.
- Performing rescue operations.
- Mathematical computation and data analysis.
- Providing diagnostics of spacecraft systems.
